poem:
**Blue Uniform**

In the haze of morning headlines—  
a cleared man stands, shadows  
clinging to his shoes,  
blue lights seep through  
narrow alleys of doubt.  
  
Steel cold rooms swell with echoes;  
silent faces—their trust, a whisper—  
like petals drifting on a shifting sea,  
unanswered questions  
rustling beneath their feet.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Met officer accused of sharing rape case footage is cleared of misconduct A Metropolitan police officer has been cleared of two counts of misconduct in public office after standing trial accused of sharing footage from two rape cases. PC Adam Aspinall Da Encarnacao, 33, from Buckinghamshire, attached to the Met’s Sapphire unit dealing with rapes and serious sexual assaults, had pleaded not guilty to both counts. He has acted as a sexual offences investigation trained". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Met officer accused of sharing rape case footage is cleared of misconduct A Metropolitan police officer has been cleared of two counts of misconduct in public office after standing trial accused of sharing footage from two rape cases. PC Adam Aspinall Da Encarnacao, 33, from Buckinghamshire, attached to the Met’s Sapphire unit dealing with rapes and serious sexual assaults, had pleaded not guilty to both counts. He has acted as a sexual offences investigation trained
